interest.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate Allowed values: null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

fixed.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually

spread.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

minMaxRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier

maxRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

upTo.description: The monetary amount for the tier

negativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier, select Yes, No, Block margin

orPercent.description: Applicable tier percentage (between 0 and 100) for interest calculations based on amount bands

margin.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate Allowed values: null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginOperation.description: This is the operand which determines if a margin is added or subtracted from the interest rate. Options are ADD or SUB

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

Identifies the details of the conditions or properties used as criterias

value.description: The value of the field on which the Alert criteria is based

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

attribute.description: Identifies the details of the conditions or properties used as criterias

periodicInterest.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate Allowed values: null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriodType.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriod.description: Define the period which has to be used to calculate the interest rate

periodicMethod.description: Indicates the method used to calculate the interest rate for period interest setup

initialResetDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset.  If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

periodicReset.description: Indicates the reset period of the periodic index defined

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

negativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier, select Yes, No, Block margin

marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginOperation.description: This is the operand which determines if a margin is added or subtracted from the interest rate. Options are ADD or SUB

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

onActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

customType.description: Defines the type of attribute used to calculate the custom rate. It is an identifier for the customized rate attributes. It may hold user defined values like currency

customName.description: Defines the name of the customized rate attribute to calculate the custom rate

customValue.description: Defines the value for the corresponding customized rate attribute to calculate custom rate

tiers.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts. Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

linkedProperty.description: Specifies the Interest component of the linked contract that should be referred for getting the Interest Rate

dayBasis.description: Contains the day basis on which the interest is calculated. Eg: 366/366, 360/365 (Interest days/days in the year)

calcThreshold.description: The user can specify that interest will only be calculated if a balance threshold is surpassed. For credit interest, the user can specify the minimum balance which must be maintained. For debit interest, the user can specify the maximum debit balance for which interest will not be calculated

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

referLimit.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

partyIds.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

payment.description: Groups the payment currency and country details

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

billProduced.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

autoSettle.description: Indicates if the settlement is automatic at the Customer / Broker side

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

dueFrequency.description: Defines the frequency date when a payment  has to be made due. When not mentioned, this will be same as the paymentFrequency

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments a year

actualAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

billsCombined.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

recalcFrequency.description: This defines the payment schedule amount recalculation frequency

settlement.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payment.description: Groups the payment currency and country details

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberOfPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments a year

adhocPaymentAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments  it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount.

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

baseDayKey.description: Indicates whether the cycling of dates should follow the base day calculation or not. Allowed values are BASE, PREVIOUS, NULL. BASE - Base day calculation will be applied. PREVIOUS/NULL - Base day calculation will not be applied

progPercentage.description: Used to specify the progressive percentage with which the system calculated payment amount has to progress on every payment

baseDay.description: Indicates the base day which will be used to cycle the Payment date

billLeadDays.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

finaliseBill.description: Defines the number of days prior to the actual payment, when a bill needs to be finalised. This allows the user or customer to make amendments to an issued bill through the Payment Holiday activity with as many number of times, between the issue date and finalisation date. When zero days is defined, then user or customer will be allowed to make amendments to an issued bill through Payment Holiday activity until the payment date

issueBill.description: Flag to indicate whether we need to issue bill and make it due separately or together. If the field is set to NO, then both would be combined and performed as a single activity

deferPeriod.description: Period that defines how long the scheduled payment should be deferred from original cycled date. If defined, then on the cycled date, system will schedule deferring makedue or deferring capitalise activities moving the bills to defer status. On actual cycled date plus Defer Period, system will schedule make due or capitalise activities where bills will be moved out from defer status to their respective status

holidayRestrictType.description: Indicates the type of holiday restriction which will be applied. Allowed values are PropertyClass, Property, Bill Type, Payment Type.

holidayRestrictItem.description: Indicates actual restricted item for holiday. It holds the value based on the holiday restriction type

periodicAttribute.description: Contains the user defined rule definition which is evaluated during the transaction based on the defined period

repaymentHolidayLimit.description: Customer is eligible for requesting payment holiday upto the limit amount specified here

includeFutureDisbursement.description: Flag to indicate if future disbursements scheduled need to be considered when deriving the constant payment amounts. If set to YES then system will arrive at a constant amount from start date until maturity date of the contract considering any disbursements and payments scheduled for future dates and interest on the outstanding principal amount and then arrives at a calculated amount. If set to NULL, the calculated amount will not consider these future disbursements and payments scheduled in its calculation

combineBills.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

minimumPaymentBillType.description: Specify the bill type for which minimum payment amount must be made due or capitalised

minimumPaymentAmount.description: minimum amount that needs to be made due or capitalised for the associated bill type

minimumPaymentProperty.description: Defines the list of properties which will be used for minimum payment amount calculation

systemId.description: System ID of the originating transaction

externalEventStatus.description: Determines the status of events sent to external system from the current system for the given activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

externalEventStatus.description: Determines the status of events sent to external system from the current system for the given activity

payment.description: Groups the payment currency and country details

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

repayment.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payInRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payInSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payout.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payOutRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay out account during the settlement process

payOutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

externalEventStatus.description: Determines the status of events sent to external system from the current system for the given activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by Transact

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

payment.description: Groups the payment currency and country details

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberOfPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments a year

adhocPaymentAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments  it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount.

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

baseDayKey.description: Indicates whether the cycling of dates should follow the base day calculation or not. Allowed values are BASE, PREVIOUS, NULL. BASE - Base day calculation will be applied. PREVIOUS/NULL - Base day calculation will not be applied

progPercentage.description: Used to specify the progressive percentage with which the system calculated payment amount has to progress on every payment

baseDay.description: Indicates the base day which will be used to cycle the Payment date

billLeadDays.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

finaliseBill.description: Defines the number of days prior to the actual payment, when a bill needs to be finalised. This allows the user or customer to make amendments to an issued bill through the Payment Holiday activity with as many number of times, between the issue date and finalisation date. When zero days is defined, then user or customer will be allowed to make amendments to an issued bill through Payment Holiday activity until the payment date

issueBill.description: Flag to indicate whether we need to issue bill and make it due separately or together. If the field is set to NO, then both would be combined and performed as a single activity

deferPeriod.description: Period that defines how long the scheduled payment should be deferred from original cycled date. If defined, then on the cycled date, system will schedule deferring makedue or deferring capitalise activities moving the bills to defer status. On actual cycled date plus Defer Period, system will schedule make due or capitalise activities where bills will be moved out from defer status to their respective status

holidayRestrictType.description: Indicates the type of holiday restriction which will be applied. Allowed values are PropertyClass, Property, Bill Type, Payment Type.

holidayRestrictItem.description: Indicates actual restricted item for holiday. It holds the value based on the holiday restriction type

periodicAttribute.description: Contains the user defined rule definition which is evaluated during the transaction based on the defined period

repaymentHolidayLimit.description: Customer is eligible for requesting payment holiday upto the limit amount specified here

includeFutureDisbursement.description: Flag to indicate if future disbursements scheduled need to be considered when deriving the constant payment amounts. If set to YES then system will arrive at a constant amount from start date until maturity date of the contract considering any disbursements and payments scheduled for future dates and interest on the outstanding principal amount and then arrives at a calculated amount. If set to NULL, the calculated amount will not consider these future disbursements and payments scheduled in its calculation

combineBills.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

minimumPaymentBillType.description: Specify the bill type for which minimum payment amount must be made due or capitalised

minimumPaymentAmount.description: minimum amount that needs to be made due or capitalised for the associated bill type

minimumPaymentProperty.description: Defines the list of properties which will be used for minimum payment amount calculation

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

activities.description: Specifies the charges which has incurred with processing of the cheque

appplicationPeriod.description: Denotes the application period for the given rule break charges which will be applied at the end of the period.If the value defined is zero, then the charges are applied immediately

applicationMethod.description: Denotes the method that needs to be applied to the rule break charges. Allowed values are Due, Defer, Capitalise. If it is set to Due then the Rule break charges are made due. If it is set to Capitalise then the Rule break charges are capitalised. If it is set to Defer then the Rule break charges are calculated but not applied immediately, charge are deferred and are collected over a period of time

chargeAutoSettle.description: This field aids turning off the automatic settlement for the corresponding charge. If set to yes settlement processing for the associated chage will be done based on the settlement configuration for the charge

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

rules.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

ruleName.description: Name of the validation rule to be checked against an online or periodic activity.

periodicAttribute.description: Contains the user defined rule definition which is evaluated during the transaction based on the defined period

balanceType.description: Type of balance (e.g. current balance, credit interest accrued, deferred commission, etc.) as defined in the institution's accounting schemas.

periodicValue.description: Contains the periodic value for a specific product condition

activityClassId.description: Id of an activity class, e.g. ACCOUNTS-ACCRUE-CHARGE or LENDING-CAPITALISE-INTEREST.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

activityClass.description: The identifier of the activity class

activity.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

restriction.description: The user can flag this field to indicate that the activity is to be restricted and can further specify whether the transaction is completely blocked or allowed with a warning. If yes then restriction type has to be specified as error or warning

ruleId.description: Used to provide the rule for non-financial transaction, for identified related signatory groups and Minimum number of signatories

restrictType.description: The type of restriction that need to be applied on the activity. Allowed values are ERROR, OVERRIDE. If it is set to ERROR then the transaction triggering this activity would be completely blocked. If it is set to OVERRIDE then the transaction triggering this activity would be allowed after displaying a warning

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

errorCode.description: Specifies the error code expected in the system which indicates the resrtiction reason for blocking the  transaction completely

appplicationPeriod.description: Denotes the application period for the given rule break charges which will be applied at the end of the period.If the value defined is zero, then the charges are applied immediately

applicationMethod.description: Denotes the method that needs to be applied to the rule break charges. Allowed values are Due, Defer, Capitalise. If it is set to Due then the Rule break charges are made due. If it is set to Capitalise then the Rule break charges are capitalised. If it is set to Defer then the Rule break charges are calculated but not applied immediately, charge are deferred and are collected over a period of time

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

runTheRule.description: Specify the rule which has to be used for evaluation

evaluation.description: This attribute defines the decision that need to be taken when a rule is passed or failed. Options available for this attribute is BREAK and SATISFY. BREAK - A defined rule has failed. SATISFY - A defined rule has passed

result.description: Status to determine requirements of the agents for scaling of services

alternateProperty.description: A property defined here will act as an alternate property if the original property is defined to be waived in evaluation result

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

tiers.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts. Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

tierType.description: Type of the tier rate. Allowed values: - BAND: rates apply within each band - LEVEL: a common rate applies, determined by the highest level

calculationType.description: Indicates calculation type for the given source balance

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

tierMinCharge.description: Indicates the minimum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

tierMaxCharge.description: Indicates the maximum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierCount.description: When charges are to be calculated based on activity count, this attribute acts as threshold for the number of times an activity is performed

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

chargeRoutine.description: This field enables the user to define a routine to apply complex conditions to calculate the charge amount as required by the user

tierGroups.description: This field defines the method of calculation of charge amount for the currency.This field will accept two values BANDS or LEVELS. If BANDS then separate calculations are to be made for each band till the base amount is reached.If LEVELS then only one is calculated and this is dependent on the level of the base Amount

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

tierMinCharge.description: Indicates the minimum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

tierMaxCharge.description: Indicates the maximum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierCount.description: When charges are to be calculated based on activity count, this attribute acts as threshold for the number of times an activity is performed

chargeType.description: Indicates the charge types which are applicable for the transaction. Example: CORRBKCHG

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

chargeRoutine.description: This field enables the user to define a routine to apply complex conditions to calculate the charge amount as required by the user

tierGroups.description: This field defines the method of calculation of charge amount for the currency.This field will accept two values BANDS or LEVELS. If BANDS then separate calculations are to be made for each band till the base amount is reached.If LEVELS then only one is calculated and this is dependent on the level of the base Amount

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

customers.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

customer.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

taxLiabilityPercentage.description: Tax liability percentage of the customer

limitAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates percentage of limit allocated to the customer out of overall limit

glAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates GL allocation percentage of the customer

includeInCRAOfCustomers.description: Denotes that the contracts created for the customers specified in this field should be included in the current customers related contracts

includeInCRAOfCustomer.description: Denotes that the contracts created for the customers specified in this field should be included in the current customers related contracts

jointLiability.description: Identifies if there is a joint liability on the limit record Allowed values: -YES -NO

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

interest.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

dayBasis.description: Contains the day basis on which the interest is calculated. Eg: 366/366, 360/365 (Interest days/days in the year)

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierNegativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier, select Yes, No, Block margin

tierPercent.description: Applicable tier percentage (between 0 and 100) for interest calculations based on amount bands

marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

customType.description: Defines the type of attribute used to calculate the custom rate. It is an identifier for the customized rate attributes. It may hold user defined values like currency

customName.description: Defines the name of the customized rate attribute to calculate the custom rate

customValue.description: Defines the value for the corresponding customized rate attribute to calculate custom rate

calcThreshold.description: The user can specify that interest will only be calculated if a balance threshold is surpassed. For credit interest, the user can specify the minimum balance which must be maintained. For debit interest, the user can specify the maximum debit balance for which interest will not be calculated

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

fixedRate.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually.

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

usagePercent.description: The percent defined will be applied on the reference rate before applying margin and other interest adjustments

type.description: The product condition has an activity type associated that drives an action.

period.description: Indicates spread of time buckets.Ex: 3M,6M,9M,10Y etc.

method.description: A pricing plan can be applied to an account, the selection is automatic or manual

initialDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset. If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

reset.description: This indicates the reset period of the index stated. System would automatically reset the periodic rate at the frequency stated here

linkedRateIndicator.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

operand.description: This field along with fieldName and value, defines the conditions for the alert to be triggered.

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

minimumTierRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier.

maximumTierRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier.

rateTierType.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts.  Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

linkedProperty.description: Specifies the Interest component of the linked contract that should be referred for getting the Interest Rate

rfrConvention.description: Define the market convention to be used as risk free rate calculation convention

rfrLookbackType.description: Specifies the type to be used for risk free rates calculation. Allowed options are NARROW, OBSERVATION SHIFT. Narrow Definition: Apply original interest periods day count to the look back rate used for this day (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Fridays weight, three days, to Wednesdays rate). Observation Shift: Apply the original day count of the look back rate (i.e. if the Wednesday rate is used for Friday, apply the Wednesdays own weight, one day, and do not use Fridays day count for it)

rfrCalculationMethod.description: Define the type of formula used to calculate the rate. There are two types.  1. Simple - Simple Average Calculation (Arithmetic Mean) 2. Compound -  Compound Average Calculation (geometric mean)

rfrLookbackDays.description: Specifies the backward looking period for the risk free rates calculation. Example  An arrangement is creating on 15-May-2020 with look back days as 2. Then during RFR compounding rate calculation, system would use the risk free rate published on 13-Mar-2020. So, it will look back to 2 days and get the rate

rfrSpreadTreatment.description: Define how the Spread inputted in the interest definition would be used as part of risk free rate calculation. Inclusive  The spread inputted in definition will be used in risk free rate formula itself to calculate the Compounding RFR rate. Exclusive  The spread inputted in the definition will be added on top of formula calculated Compounding RFR rate

rfrPeriodDayCount.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will uses only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will uses the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

rfrRoundingRule.description: Determine how the risk free rates will be used  when calculating the compounding risk free rate. TODAY  The formula will uses only risk free rate till TODAY from Period Start date, and calculate the Compounding rate.  FULL  The formula will uses the risk free rates for FULL period from Period Start date to Period End date when calculating compounding rate.

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

payment.description: Groups the payment currency and country details

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberOfPayments.description: Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments a year

adhocPaymentAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments  it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount.

baseDay.description: Indicates the base day which will be used to cycle the Payment date

holidayRestrictTypes.description: Contains the payment reference and details for each bulk record.

holidayRestrictType.description: Indicates the type of holiday restriction which will be applied. Allowed values are PropertyClass, Property, Bill Type, Payment Type.

holidayRestrictItem.description: Indicates actual restricted item for holiday. It holds the value based on the holiday restriction type

periodicAttributes.description: Contains the user defined rule definition which is evaluated during the transaction based on the defined period

periodicAttribute.description: Contains the user defined rule definition which is evaluated during the transaction based on the defined period

repaymentHolidayLimit.description: Customer is eligible for requesting payment holiday upto the limit amount specified here

minimumPaymentBillType.description: Specify the bill type for which minimum payment amount must be made due or capitalised

minimumPaymentAmount.description: minimum amount that needs to be made due or capitalised for the associated bill type

minimumPaymentProperty.description: Defines the list of properties which will be used for minimum payment amount calculation

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

baseDayKey.description: Indicates whether the cycling of dates should follow the base day calculation or not. Allowed values are BASE, PREVIOUS, NULL. BASE - Base day calculation will be applied. PREVIOUS/NULL - Base day calculation will not be applied

progPercentage.description: Used to specify the progressive percentage with which the system calculated payment amount has to progress on every payment

billLeadDays.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

finaliseBill.description: Defines the number of days prior to the actual payment, when a bill needs to be finalised. This allows the user or customer to make amendments to an issued bill through the Payment Holiday activity with as many number of times, between the issue date and finalisation date. When zero days is defined, then user or customer will be allowed to make amendments to an issued bill through Payment Holiday activity until the payment date

issueBill.description: Flag to indicate whether we need to issue bill and make it due separately or together. If the field is set to NO, then both would be combined and performed as a single activity

deferPeriod.description: Period that defines how long the scheduled payment should be deferred from original cycled date. If defined, then on the cycled date, system will schedule deferring makedue or deferring capitalise activities moving the bills to defer status. On actual cycled date plus Defer Period, system will schedule make due or capitalise activities where bills will be moved out from defer status to their respective status

combineBills.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

recalcFrequency.description: This defines the payment schedule amount recalculation frequency

includeFutureDisbursement.description: Flag to indicate if future disbursements scheduled need to be considered when deriving the constant payment amounts. If set to YES then system will arrive at a constant amount from start date until maturity date of the contract considering any disbursements and payments scheduled for future dates and interest on the outstanding principal amount and then arrives at a calculated amount. If set to NULL, the calculated amount will not consider these future disbursements and payments scheduled in its calculation

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

expiryDays.description: Defines the expiry date for the payoff bill. The number of days defined would be taken as working days and expiry date for the payoff bill would be calculated as payoff date plus the number of working days defined in this field. When the expiry date is reached the payoff bill would be deleted

settleDues.description: Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not. By setting this field to YES, auto settlement of future dues would be enabled and setting it to null or NO will not settle the due amounts automatically

action.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

repayment.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payInRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payInSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payout.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payOutRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay out account during the settlement process

payOutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

trancheStartDate.description: Start date after which the tracheAmount can be withdrawn from the loan as per the withdrawal agreement.

trancheEndDate.description: End date by when the tracheAmount can be withdrawn from the loan as per the withdrawal agreement made

trancheAmount.description: Amount agreed for withdrawal from the loan on within the trancheStateDates and trancheEndDates

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

coolingPeriod.description: Indicates the number of days to be considered for closure of account after renewal or rollover date

cancellationPeriod.description: Indicates the Period beyond which a contract is cancelled if it not fully funded in case of deposit or fully disbursed in case of the loan

onMaturity.description: If set to due residual amount will be due on the payment end date

hasTranches.description: Indicates if the loan is disbursed through a withdrawal agreement where the agreed loan amount is available for withdrawal upon the agreed schedule or based on user request.

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

beneficialOwner.description: Indicates the customer who is the legal owner of the arrangement and is the responsible customer of the contract with bank.

productDescription.description: Indicates the description of the Product

arrangementStartDate.description: Indicates the date on which the arrangement was created

originalContractDate.description: Indicates the original contract date of the arrangement which was migrated from the legacy system.

arrangementStatus.description: Status of the arrangement. E.g. AUTH, CLOSE, UNAUTH etc.

arrangementActivityId.description: The unique identifier of an arrangement activity

externalEventStatus.description: Determines the status of events sent to external system from the current system for the given activity

adjustmentActivityReference.description: The unique identifier of an compensatory activity triggered for the given activity

closureNotes.description: This field is used to hold the notes for the reason of account closure

closureNote.description: This field is used to hold the notes for the reason of account closure

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

automaticRun.description: This field would be used during the Simulation scenarios. The following options are supported: 1. SIMULATE : The system would automatically trigger the Simulation the moment the simulated transaction is authorized. 2. EXECUTE : The system would automatically trigger the Execution of simulation the moment simulated transaction is authorized. It is assumed that the user would have simulated first before using this option. 3. DIRECT.EXECUTE: If the user does not want to do a two step process of simulating and executing, then this option may be utilized which does both actions in one go

simulationRunReference.description: Indicates the runner Reference ID for simulation activity

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

closureReason.description: This field contains the reason for closing the account

closureNotes.description: This field is used to hold the notes for the reason of account closure

closureNote.description: This field is used to hold the notes for the reason of account closure

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

automaticRun.description: This field would be used during the Simulation scenarios. The following options are supported: 1. SIMULATE : The system would automatically trigger the Simulation the moment the simulated transaction is authorized. 2. EXECUTE : The system would automatically trigger the Execution of simulation the moment simulated transaction is authorized. It is assumed that the user would have simulated first before using this option. 3. DIRECT.EXECUTE: If the user does not want to do a two step process of simulating and executing, then this option may be utilized which does both actions in one go

simulationRunReference.description: Indicates the runner Reference ID for simulation activity

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in YYYYMMDD format

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

closureReason.description: This field contains the reason for closing the account

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

paymentDate.description: The date on which a payment is due

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

interestAmount.description: The accrued Interest due or accrued.

principalAmount.description: Indicates the Principal Amount of the loan or a deposit

outstandingAmount.description: Contains the aggregate outstanding principal amount thereof after giving effect to any borrowings and prepayments or repayments of Committed Loans

scheduleType.description: The type of event schedule. The main ones are interest payment (IP) , principal increase (PI), rate reset (RR).

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

interestRate.description: Identifies the bid rate of the related currency for the defined time period

interestPropertyName.description: Contains the property name of loan interest such as penalty Interest and principal interest.

compoundType.description: Contains the frequency type of compound in loan. For example, annually or monthly.

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

tierType.description: Type of the tier rate. Allowed values: - BAND: rates apply within each band - LEVEL: a common rate applies, determined by the highest level

balanceTypes.description: Type of balance (e.g. current balance, credit interest accrued, deferred commission, etc.) as defined in the institution's accounting schemas.

schedules.description: Indicates where this pool may be run either online or End of the day.

schedulePaymentMethod.description: Denotes the payment schedule method of the loan such as capitalise, pay, due and maintain.

scheduleProperty.description: Denotes the property of the loans schedule

schedulePaymentAmount.description: Contains the amount payable in the schedule

schedulePaymentFrequency.description: Indicates the frequency associated - Eg. Pay to customer or paid by bank

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

maturesIn.description: Indicates a date or period within which an account gets matured

coolingOffDate.description: Indicates cooling off period for an account until which pre-closure can be triggered without incurring any fees or charges.

nextPaymentAmount.description: Indicates the payment amount to be settled in the next schedule

nextPaymentDate.description: Indicates next payment date for the contract

virtualBalance.description: Contains the virtual balance of the collateral

paidScheduleCount.description: Count of the paid dates for repayment.

dueScheduleCount.description: Count of the due dates for repayment.

futureScheduleCount.description: Count of the future scheduled payments involving the principal and interest for a given loan

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

propertyName.description: Indicates the  property description to which benefit has been applied

interestAmount.description: The accrued Interest due or accrued.

collateralName.description: Contains the name of the collateral

executionValue.description: Denotes the value for signing the document at what is commonly referred to as the closing of the sale

thirdPartyValue.description: Denotes the value given by any individual who does not have a direct connection with a legal transaction but might be affected by it

netNominal.description: Denotes the sum of the Quantity

totalCredits.description: Contains the total number of credits

totalDebits.description: Contains the total number of debits

commitmentAmount.description: Indicates the total amount which will be lent or deposited for the term

totalDue.description: This amount represents the total due amount for that period.

totalPendingWithdrawalAmount.description: Contains the total withdrawal amount on hold until payment execution date

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

closureNote.description: This field is used to hold the notes for the reason of account closure

activityId.description: The identifier of the activity

automaticRun.description: This field would be used during the Simulation scenarios. The following options are supported: 1. SIMULATE : The system would automatically trigger the Simulation the moment the simulated transaction is authorized. 2. EXECUTE : The system would automatically trigger the Execution of simulation the moment simulated transaction is authorized. It is assumed that the user would have simulated first before using this option. 3. DIRECT.EXECUTE: If the user does not want to do a two step process of simulating and executing, then this option may be utilized which does both actions in one go

simulationRunReference.description: Indicates the runner Reference ID for simulation activity

effectiveDate.description: The date on which the principal movement is effected

currencyId.description: The identifier of the curreny. The is the 3 letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

closureReason.description: This field contains the reason for closing the account

fixedamount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

expiryDays.description: Defines the expiry date for the payoff bill. The number of days defined would be taken as working days and expiry date for the payoff bill would be calculated as payoff date plus the number of working days defined in this field. When the expiry date is reached the payoff bill would be deleted

settleDues.description: Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not. By setting this field to YES, auto settlement of future dues would be enabled and setting it to null or NO will not settle the due amounts automatically

settlement.description: Indicates settlement conditions associated with the account

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payinRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPOProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinAmount.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPOProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.
